hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Majid ibn Abi Yazid: During the time of Yazid ibn al-Muhallab, I and Hajr ibn Abi Nasr set out for Mecca. We passed by a water called al-Rukhakh, and they told us: There is here a man who has seen the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. So we came to an old man and asked him: Did you see the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? He said: Yes, and he wrote for me about this water. He brought out a skin upon which was written the letter of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. We asked: What is your name? He said: al-Adda' ibn Khalid. We asked: What did you hear from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? He said: I was under his she-camel on the day of Arafat while she was chewing her cud. He said: 'O people, what day is this? What month is this? What land is this?' We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'Is this not a sacred month, a sacred land, and a sacred day?' We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'Indeed, your blood, your wealth, and your honor are sacred to you, just as the sacredness of this day of yours, in this month of yours, in this land of yours, until the Day you meet your Lord. O Allah, have I conveyed (the message)? O Allah, be witness.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Majid Abu Amr: We came to al-Rukhakh and entered upon a man from the Bani Amir ibn Rabi'ah, called al-Adda' ibn Khalid ibn Hawdhah. We greeted him and he returned the greeting. He said: I performed the Farewell Pilgrimage with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. I saw the Messenger of Allah ﷺ standing between the two stirrups on the day of Arafat, calling out: 'Indeed, your blood and your wealth are sacred to you, just as the sacredness of this day of yours, in this month of yours, in this land of yours, until the Day you meet him. Have I conveyed (the message)? Have I conveyed (the message)? Have I conveyed (the message)?' They said: Yes. He said: 'O Allah, be witness,' saying this three times.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by 'Abbad ibn Shurhabīl: I came to Medina during the time of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. I entered an orchard and took some of its ears of grain. The owner of the orchard came and struck me and took my garment. I went to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and the owner of the orchard was following me. I mentioned that to him (the Prophet ﷺ). The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: 'By Allah, you did not teach him when he was ignorant, nor did you feed him when he was hungry.' Then he ordered him to return my garment to me, and ordered for me a wasq or half a wasq of dates.
